Description: Prosecution of company owner Phillip McGinn, was carrying out work to replace roof tiles on a detached dormer bungalow in Lydiate without any scaffolding or edge protection in place to prevent them from falling a distance liable to cause personal injury. An investigation by the Health and Safety Executive (HSE) found that he had failed to take suitable and sufficient measures to ensure that work at height was carried out safely by failing to provide sufficient work equipment for preventing a fall or to minimise the distance or consequences of a fall.
